ext_descriptions.ext_description: The Cartesian_transformation type is a mechanism to refer to an instance of either a 2d or 3d cartesian transformation operator.
The Geometric_mapping_target type is a mechanism to refer to an instance of Axis_placement, of Cartesian_transformation_2d or of Cartesian_transformation_3d.
The Template_instance type is a mechanism to refer to an instance of Mapping_based_template_instance or of Transformation_based_template_instance.

A Numerical_representation_context is a type of Representation_context in which units and uncertainties may be defined. These units and uncertainties apply to the instances of Representation_item that are used in that context.
The units attribute specifies the set of units that apply for attribute values of instances of Representation_item used in that context.
The accuracies attribute specifies the uncertainty measures that apply on attribute values of instances of Representation_item used in that context.

A Geometric_coordinate_space is a type of Numerical_representation_context that defines a coordinate space where geometric elements can be defined. It is either two-dimensional or three-dimensional.
There shall be at least two units specified for the Geometric_coordinate_space: one length unit and one plane angle unit.
The length unit applies to each coordinate direction.
The length unit millimeter and the angle unit radian are examples of units that may assigned to a Geometric_coordinate_space.
The origin for coordinate values is implicitly defined as being the cartesian point whose coordinates are all zero.
the dimensionality of the geometric space.
the dimensionality shall be greater than zero.

A Detailed_geometric_model_element is a type of Representation_item. It identifies a geometric construct.
The Detailed_geometric_model_element needs to be specialized in the application modules that use the present application module.
A Detailed_geometric_model_element shall be an item of a Geometric_model or serves to create an item of a Geometric_model.
The instances of Geometric_model that contain the Detailed_geometric_model_element shall all have the same dimension_count

A Geometric_model is a type of Representation dedicated to the description of geometric constructs.
The Geometric_model is founded in a Geometric_coordinate_space.
The items of Geometric_model are instances of Detailed_geometric_model_element.
The Geometric_coordinate_space in which the Geometric_model is defined.
The version_id specifies the version identifier of the Geometric_model.
The instances of Detailed_geometric_model_element that are included in the Geometric_model.

The model_extent specifies the radius of a sphere that encloses all elements of the geometric model. The centre of the sphere is located at the origin of the Geometric_coordinate_space of the Geometric_model.
The model_extent need not be specified for a particular Geometric_model.
A Cartesian_point is a type of Detailed_geometric_model_element that defines a point by a list of up to 3 cartesian coordinates.
The list of up to 3 length measure values that define the cartesian coordinates of the point.

A Direction is a type of Detailed_geometric_model_element that defines a 2 or 3 dimensional vector. A Direction is not located in a geometric space but is used in the definition of geometric entities like axis_placements.

The list of 2 or 3 length measure values that define the direction ratios of the direction. The coordinates of a Direction may not be normalised and the actual magnitudes of the components have no effect upon the direction being defined: only the ratios x:y:z or x:y are significant.

An Axis_placement is a type of Detailed_geometric_model_element that defines a right-handed, 2D or 3D, coordinate system.
If the Axis_placement belongs to a 3D geometric space, the third direction of the coordinate system is defined by the vector product of x_axis and y_axis.
The Cartesian_point that defines the position of the Axis_placement in the geometric space.
The Direction that defines the first axis of the Axis_placement.
The Direction that defines the second axis of the Axis_placement.
The dimensionality of the Axis_placement. It is equal to the number of coordinates of the origin.
The dimensionality of the Axis_placement shall be greater than 1.
The number of coordinates of the x_axis shall be equal to the number of coordinates of the origin of the Axis_placement.
The number of coordinates of the y_axis shall be equal to the number of coordinates of the origin of the Axis_placement.
The vector product of x_axis and y_axis shall not be result in a null vector.

A Cartesian_transformation_2d is a geometric transformation defined in a 2D geometric space by a 2*2 matrix and a cartesian point.
Let be:
MM, the 2*2 multiplication matrix of the cartesian transformation
A, the point of the cartesian transformation
P, a point in the geometric space
Q, the result of the application of the transformation to P
The coordinates of Q shall be obtained by the formula: Q = MM*P + A
The array of two instances of Direction that defines the multiplication matrix of the transformation.
The Cartesian_point that defines the position of the Axis_placement in the geometric space.
The first element of the matrix shall refer to a 2-dimensional Direction.
The second element of the matrix shall refer to a 3-dimensional Direction.
The translation point shall have 2 coordinates.

A Cartesian_transformation_3d is a geometric transformation defined in a 3D geometric space by a 3*3 matrix and a cartesian point.
Let be:
MM, the 3*3 multiplication matrix of the cartesian transformation
A, the point of the cartesian transformation
P, a point in the geometric space
Q, the result of the application of the transformation to P
The coordinates of Q shall be obtained by the formula: Q = MM*P + A
The array of three instances of Direction that defines the multiplication matrix of the transformation.
The Cartesian_point that defines the position of the Axis_placement in the geometric space.
The first element of the matrix shall refer to a 3-dimensional Direction.
The second element of the matrix shall refer to a 3-dimensional Direction.
The third element of the matrix shall refer to a 3-dimensional Direction.
The translation point shall have 3 coordinates.

An Axis_placement_mapping is a geometric transformation defined by a source Axis_placement and a target Axis_placement that results from the transformation of the source one.
Both instances of Axis_placement shall have the same dimensionality.
The transformation shall be computed as the isometric transformation that maps:
the origin of the source onto the origin of the target;
the x_axis of the source onto the x_axis of the target;
the y_axis of the source onto the y_axis of the target.
by construction, the determinant of the transformation matrix equals one.
The Axis_placement that plays the role of source in the transformation.
The Axis_placement that plays the role of target in the transformation.
The source and the target shall have the same dimensionality.

An Axis_placement_transformation_mapping is a geometric transformation defined by a source Axis_placement and a target Cartesian_transformation.
The transformation shall be computed as the transformation that maps:
the origin of the source onto the translation point of the target;
the x_axis of the source onto the first element of the multiplication_matrix of the target;
the y_axis of the source onto the second element of the multiplication_matrix of the target.
in case the transformation is a 3D transformation, the normalised vector product of the x_axis and the y_axis of the source onto the third element of the multiplication_matrix of the target.
This kind of mapping enables to represent non isometric transformations, including symmetry and projection transformations.
The Axis_placement that plays the role of source in the transformation.
The Cartesian_transformation that plays the role of target in the transformation.
The source and the target shall have the same dimensionality.
The Geometric_model that is replicated.
The Axis_placement that identifies the source of the mapping.
The Axis_placement or the Cartesian_transformation that identifies the target of the mapping.

A Transformation_based_template_instance is the replication of a Geometric_model. The replication transformation is defined by a cartesian transformation.
In the case where the Geometric_coordinate_space of the replicated model is not the same as the Geometric_coordinate_space in which the Template_instance is founded, care shall be taken of any difference in the length units of both the instances of Geometric_coordinate_space, as unit conversion may be required.
The mapping-table defines two interpretations for this ARM entity. The first one uses the MIM entity mapped_item which is semantically equivalent to the Axis_placement_mapping and Axis_placement_transformation_mapping entities. The second one uses the MIM entity representation_relationship_with_transformation. Although this latter entity is not semantically equivalent to the ARM entity, the second interpretation is kept because of its use in some implementations.
The Geometric_model that is replicated.
The Cartesian_transformation that is applied, in the replication of the replicated_model, to all its geometric elements.
